page.title: 14Farming Droxford,Footpaths
page.content: My Dad is a farmer.Our farm is called Bushy Down Farm.It covers 706 acres, 655 acres are arable.The crops are wheat,barley and oil seed rape.Peas and tick beans are break crops to give the ground a rest.We keep about 70 beef cattle and 100 fat lambs are kept from Oct till Feb.This year we have built a new shed and bought a sprayer. I have a new sister,all the other babies born this year in Droxford have been boys.Late July lots of rain but our crops are not to spoilt.{Class 3} surveyed the 4 south squares of grid. Most footpaths were clear with stiles or kissing gates.The best path wasn't clear it went across a field or ripe barley,we followed a tractor wheel trail.The village people like the downs,river and Beech walk;new trees have been planted.The{Wayfarers' walk} crosses Droxford.
